results.title: I didn't know you could tie
results.creator_credit: WGBH Educational Foundation and D. Keith Carlson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A child is assisted by the teacher to clarify her feelings about another child sho is engaged in an independent activity. The child’s inappropriate criticism is mildly reprimanded.

results.title: I Cover the Waterfront
results.brief_description: A reporter uses a girl’s friendship to expose her father’s smuggling activities. “I Cover the Waterfront” is a tough and daring melodrama about organised crime and the brave men who try to expose it. Stars Claudette Colbert. Rated: G

results.title: I confess
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A compelling thriller based on the privacy of the Catholic confessional. A young priest, played by Montgomery Clift, hears the confession of a murderer. Later, the priest himself is accused of the murder, owing to his friendship with a woman who was being blackmailed by the victim. Anne Baxter plays the woman, Karl Malden the police inspector and Brian Aherne the Police Prosecutor. Adapted from the play by Paul Anthelme.

results.title: I Claudius. Parts III and IV
results.brief_description: Claudius continues the history of his diabolical family. Plunged further into madness, Caligula imagines himself to be the most divine god of Rome. The power he wields causes him to act with cruelty and tyranny. Ultimately he is murdered by those no longer willing to suffer injustice. Claudius, the “old fool”, is reluctantly elected Emperor as prophesised. In Part IV, Claudius married to the cunning, unfaithful Messalina, rules wisely but longs for the Republic. These programs contain scenes of violence and nudity.

results.title: I Claudius. Parts I and II
results.brief_description: Claudius reflects on the history of his family at the twilight of his life. Claudius - lame, a stutterer and considered a fool, manages to stay alive during the turbulent times of the early emperors of Rome. Here his evil grandmother Livia, married to Emperor Augustus, poisons her enemies, his uncle Tiberius runs a depraved court and his nephew Caligula sinks into a madness which manifests itself in unspeakable cruelties. Claudius seeks to tell the truth about the good and bad apples of his family tree. Derek Jacobi as Claudius, Sian Phillips as Livia received British Academy Awards. Also stars Brian Blessed as Augustus and John Hurt as Caligula.

results.title: I Can take care of myself
results.brief_description: Samantha is having a hard time getting used to the idea that she should not only keep herself neat and tidy, but she should also take care of her room, as she say, “Why should I clean things when they just get dirty again?” Suddenly, while she is pondering this age-old question, her stuffed penguin comes to life and shows Sam the value of keeping yourself and your surroundings clear and clean. This video examines the important topics of personal hygiene, grooming and keeping things neat and in order, as well as family teamwork and respect for family members. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included. No other credits available.

results.title: I can make music
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, Ursula Kolbe and Tom Zubrycki
results.brief_description: Shows various methods of working with children, including the Orff method, which involves young children in actively responding to music. Highlights movement to music and the music of different cultures from places such as Mexico and South America. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
